revised_title: Aerobic Utilization of Pyruvate in Plant Tissues: Metabolic Pathways and Substrate Replacement
tldr: The authors conducted experiments using 14C-labeled pyruvate to study its aerobic utilization in plant tissues, such as apple and barley roots. They found that pyruvate was partially oxidized in the tricarboxylic acid cycle and gave rise to alanine and other amino acids. No pyruvate was converted back to sugars or other carbohydrates in either tissue. This study provides insights into the metabolic pathways and substrate replacement in plant tissues.
